note: Specialized runner - see extra_data for details

vulnerability_location.description: External calls to msg.sender.send are made before updating games[msg.sender].state, allowing the recipient to re-enter the contract while the state is still Ongoing.
Multiple external calls to msg.sender.send that revert on failure, allowing a malicious or gas-exhausting fallback to block execution and lock the game state
Deck.deal uses block.blockhash(block.number), block.timestamp (now), and player input to seed keccak256 for randomness, which is predictable and miner-manipulable
Using block.timestamp in keccak256 for randomness allows miners to manipulate the outcome
Floating pragma version (‘^0.4.9’) allows the contract to be compiled with any 0.4.x compiler ≥0.4.9, leading to inconsistent behavior across compiler versions
